summary.para: The AudioClientProperties structure is used to set the parameters that describe the properties of the client's audio stream.

remarks.para: Starting with Windows 10, hardware-offloaded audio streams must be event driven. This means that if you call and set the bIsOffload parameter of the AudioClientProperties to TRUE, you must specify the AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_EVENTCALLBACK flag in the StreamFlags parameter to .

summary.para: The size of the AudioClientProperties structure, in bytes.
Boolean value to indicate whether or not the audio stream is hardware-offloaded.
An enumeration that is used to specify the category of the audio stream.
